column1: It’s very suspect of the FDA to withhold authorization of plasma for COVID patients - a treatment used thousands of times every day for various conditions. This should be a decision between patient & doctor. Does someone at the FDA have a political agenda? https://t.co/rhwE4xbzA3

Last night Twitter censored @realDonaldTrump for suggesting children are far less susceptible to COVID-19 than adults - a well-known fact - because it goes against the left-wing agenda to keep schools closed people out of work and destroy our economy to influence the election. https://t.co/jcju4j6bBb

A German study this month found children may actually slow the transmission of COVID-19. Out of more than 2000 blood samples - including 500 from teachers - only 12 had antibodies. Children may not act as “viral shedders” like adults to transmit the virus https://t.co/lIDKcMzy0r

Yale epidemiologist Dr. Harvey Risch: “When this inexpensive oral medication [hydroxychloroquine] is given very early in the course of illness before the virus has had time to multiply beyond control it has shown to be HIGHLY EFFECTIVE” against COVID-19. https://t.co/imjiGKvYNv

Warden Sandy McCain of Raymond Laborde Correctional Center in Avoyelles Parish died of complications due to COVID-19 after serving his community with distinction for 30 years. We appreciate his service & that of so many others during this difficult time. https://t.co/yNAOSUWeNp

COVID-19 Progress Report:  Testing for those in need ✅  Help for the uninsured ✅   Hospital ships deployed ✅   Ventilators supplied ✅    Infection curve flattened ✅   Vaccine underway ✅  Democrat help ❌                       @realDonaldTrump’s leadership: exemplary.

Great to hear @SteveScalise will serve on @realDonaldTrump’s bipartisan Task Force on Reopening the Economy. Steve will ensure Louisiana’s needs are known as we strike a balance between limiting COVID-19 spread & preventing long-term damage to our economy. https://t.co/kn6xdYNe5T

Today I sent a letter to DOJ requesting that funds provided to Louisiana District Attorneys through the CARES Act be made available to cover operating losses due to COVID-19. Our District Attorneys must be able to continue their vital mission in support of the justice system. https://t.co/q2cJD0Aga4

I’m at Monroe Airport preparing for our flyover of Monroe with the Aeroshell Aerobatic Team to thank first responders & front line personnel helping us through the coronavirus outbreak and recent tornadoes. Be sure to come outside & see these awesome planes fly over at 1:00pm! https://t.co/heMRQxJwEL

Today I sent a letter to President @realDonaldTrump thanking him for his assistance thus far in countering the coronavirus outbreak and requesting additional federal cooperation and resources as we recover from tornado damage inflicted on Easter Sunday. Help is on the way. https://t.co/st6GxetuuY

I joined America's Newsroom on Fox News this morning to discuss yesterday’s tornado damage in Monroe. Along with the coronavirus outbreak the people of Louisiana are having a difficult time but we’re hopeful that things will improve. Full interview: https://t.co/kG0BAAs5k9 https://t.co/eSzPnjPvt5
I'll be joining America's Newsroom on Fox News at 8:10am CT this morning to discuss yesterday's tornado in northern Louisiana and the coronavirus response. https://t.co/gV146H9mud
Smitty's Supply Inc in Roseland is a great example of a 5th District company that switched gears to produce hand sanitizer to fight the COVID-19 outbreak.   https://t.co/M4l9SKFpRF

As I said when I first brought this to the public’s attention abortion clinics should have closed immediately to protect the public and save protective equipment for medical professionals treating COVID-19 patients. This is completely unacceptable. https://t.co/acDNVl9Eno

Louisianans are sacrificing their freedom & economic well-being to stay home & slow the spread of COVID-19 but abortion clinics in Shreveport & Baton Rouge are conducting business as usual. This is a flagrant disregard for public health & they should close immediately.

I’m thankful for @realDonaldTrump’s leadership during this national emergency. Many more people will be infected with COVID-19 before the situation improves but social distancing and good hygiene can slow the infection rate and keep our hospitals from being overwhelmed. https://t.co/Fe46R1iq4T

On this National Doctors Day I want to thank all of our healthcare professionals who are working on the front lines of the coronavirus outbreak to help those in need and keep our communities safe. https://t.co/KDCOUdjGUM

This great piece of reporting by @GregHilburn1 illustrates the impact of COVID-19 on those with underlying medical conditions. It’s very important to keep your distance and stay at home if possible for the sake of yourself and others. https://t.co/zEl5nAjZUX

Spoke to @Varneyco on @FoxBusiness this morning about the success we’ve seen treating COVID-19 patients with hydroxychloroquine as @realDonaldTrump has said. The FDA is allowing its prescription use on a case-by-case basis by medical professionals. https://t.co/ausVkGdk6q

If you or a family member is in need of information on the coronavirus the federal and state response or resources for businesses veterans students and others impacted please visit my website: https://t.co/9jgEsWgtxa
Good news for northeast Louisiana medical facilities which have nearly $500000 in federal funding on the way to help with the coronavirus response.   https://t.co/I5HQ8oNz1s

As a physician who continues to see patients in a clinical setting & through house calls I wholeheartedly agree with @realDonaldTrump’s initiative to use hydroxychloroquine in the treatment of coronavirus. The benefits - in lives saved - far outweigh the possible side effects.

Americans along the Gulf Coast and especially here in Louisiana depend on the oil and gas industry for their livelihood. A temporary reduction in royalties is needed given the difficulties of low market prices and decreased demand due to the coronavirus. https://t.co/7h1X5mP0zc

The U.S. Small Business Administration has made the necessary declaration to allow Louisiana businesses access to up to $2 million in low-interest loans to help overcome the temporary loss of revenue due to coronavirus. Apply here: https://t.co/c9IXi1rxan
The @LADeptHealth has partnered with @launitedways to provide the most updated information on the coronavirus to Louisianans: dial 211 Text LACOVID to 898-211 or visit https://t.co/1PD4L7KftZ
For the federal government’s recommendations and actions taken to slow the spread of the coronavirus visit https://t.co/YgEXLPgjnY

.@realDonaldTrump’s national emergency declaration allows even more resources to be marshaled against the coronavirus. His declaration of a national day of prayer shows his appreciation for this nation’s dependence on a great God. Stay strong and we will get through this together https://t.co/aCLZ7rnoN1
My colleagues and I on the GOP Doctors Caucus put together a public service announcement on the coronavirus. I hope you find it helpful. https://t.co/FNre1cPCgC

.@realDonaldTrump’s proactive response to the Wuhan coronavirus will limit incoming sources of infection identify&treat the infected & protect vulnerable populations from future infection. If China had been transparent & taken outside help to begin with we’d be better off now.

I'm proud to say President Trump has been on top of the Coronavirus threat from day one. From appointing Vice President Pence to head the task force to his decision to limit travel from areas impacted by the virus I believe his actions are in line with a proactive response.
